item.title: 4. Health Safety and Welfare
item.description: *Taken from The Civil Engineering Exam 4. Health Safety and Welfare Health and Safety is a serious and important topic in the construction industry.

item.title: Commercial client
item.description: The following information is a summary of the government guidance on the CDM regulations. Commercial client A commercial client has construction carried out as part of their business.

item.title: Contractor
item.description: Contractor A contractor is anyone manages construction work, or who directly employs or engages construction workers. Contractors can include subcontractors, any individual self-employed worker or business that carries out and manages construction work.

item.title: Designer
item.description: Designer A designer is an organisation or individual whose work involves preparing or modifying designs, drawings, specifications, bills of quantity or design calculations.

item.title: Domestic client
item.description: Domestic client The domestic client is different to the Commercial client in that the client is not part of any business, and is not taking on the construction work as part of their business.

item.title: Principal contractor
item.description: Principal contractor A principal contractor is appointed by the client to control the construction phase of any project involving multiple contractors.
